laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 12.8 g/dL on Hospital Day 2.
Decreased to 9600 per mm3 on Hospital Day 2.

laboratory_examinations.date: Follow-up Visit 1 week after Care Discharge
laboratory_examinations.findings: Tests for B. henselae and B. quintana IgG antibodies were borderline positive with a titer of 1:128.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Tests for IgM antibodies remained negative.

laboratory_examinations.date: Follow-up Visit 13 days after initial presentation
laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum test for treponemal-specific antibodies was positive; rapid plasma reagin test was reactive at a 1:64 dilution.
Initial value was 738 U/L (reference range, 45 to 115).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased to 638 U/L one week after the first penicillin injection.
